cleaned_text: Online medication-assisted treatment (MAT) programs provide virtual care for those struggling with addiction. Patients meet with clinical care teams through video sessions and are prescribed medications that help manage cravings and reduce withdrawal symptoms. If you're interested in trying medication-assisted treatment, below you'll find the best addiction treatment programs available online. Best Online Medication Treatment Programs for Addiction Here is our list of the best online addiction programs that offer medication-assisted treatment: - Best Overall Online Medication-Assisted Treatment Program - [Workit Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/workit-health-reviews/) - Honorable Mention - [Ophelia](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/ophelia-review/) - Best for Dual-Diagnosis Services - [Eleanor Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/eleanor-health-review/) - Best for Alcohol Use Disorder & Mindful Drinking - [Ria Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/ria-health-reviews/) - Best for Opioid Use Disorder - [Bicycle Health](#bicycle-health-best-for-opioid-use-disorder) - Best for Community Connection - [Monument](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/monument-reviews/) - Best Personalized Pharmacy Services - [PursueCare](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/pursuecare-reviews/) Workit Health - Best Overall Medication-Assisted Treatment Program [Workit Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/workit-health-reviews/) is an online addiction treatment program that provides a wide range of services, including medication-assisted treatment, dual-diagnosis services, and recovery coaching. Workit Health is available in select states and accepts several forms of insurance. The cost of care depends on your state, insurance provider, and personalized treatment plan. Pros & Cons of Workit Health How Much Does Workit Health Cost? Workit Health's cost will depend on where you live, your insurance, and your personalized treatment plan. To offer an example of pricing, when I called to ask about the weekly cost for someone without insurance in Florida, a representative told me it would cost $15.00 for an initial registration fee and $75.00 a week plus the cost of any medication. Key Services of Workit Health Workit Health won the best overall medication-assisted treatment program award because it truly takes a "whole-person" approach to treating addiction. A whole-person approach includes medication-assisted treatment and some form of therapy or counseling, which has proven to be incredibly effective. (FN2) Workit Health treats several forms of addiction, including opioid use disorder, alcohol use disorder, and other stimulant addictions. Their care teams include psychiatrists, therapists, and recovery counselors. You can choose to work one-on-one with a licensed mental health professional or attend group therapy sessions. Workit Health also includes recovery coaching nationwide for behavioral addictions, such as gambling, sex, porn, or disordered eating. Workit Health goes a step further by offering several hundred educational online courses so patients can learn about addiction, coping strategies, and tools to help them through recovery. The coursework covers therapeutic techniques like [cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT)](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/cognitive-behavioral-therapy/), [interpersonal psychotherapy](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/interpersonal-therapy/), and [family systems therapy](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/family-systems-therapy/). Several reviews online mention an appreciation for Workit Health's courses and how the topics help patients discover healthy ways to manage their addictions, as well as relationships, budgets, work-life balance, and overall well-being. Workit Health earned 4.5 out of 5 stars from our independent review. To learn more about this program, check out our in-depth [review of Workit Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/workit-health-review/). How to Sign Up for Workit Health You can sign up for Workit Health by visiting the [Workit Health website](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/recommends/workit-health-reviews/). Key Services of Eleanor Health Eleanor Health earns our award for best dual-diagnosis services because it curates treatment plans for mental health conditions and addiction. A dual diagnosis is when someone is struggling with a substance abuse disorder and a mental health disorder at the same time. Many people facing addiction will often battle depression, anxiety, PTSD, and other conditions that can impact their sobriety. 3 Eleanor Health does an amazing job of addressing a patient's addiction and overall mental health with medication and therapy at the start of their treatment program. Patients enrolled in Eleanor Health's program can attend individual therapy, group therapy, marriage/couples counseling, or family therapy. The combination of psychiatry and therapy services emphasizes their whole-person approach to treating addiction. If you feel you might be facing a mental health condition that's affecting your recovery, I highly recommend Eleanor Health's services. With Ria Health, you can choose to quit alcohol entirely or cut back, and your care team will design a medication-assisted treatment plan to help you achieve this. Ria Health also offers one-on-one and group sessions with recovery coaches. Recovery coaches are licensed mental health professionals with strong backgrounds in addiction recovery therapy. Your recovery coach is there to provide tools and coping strategies to help you manage cravings, rebuild relationships, set realistic and appropriate goals, and develop healthy behavior patterns. If you feel you're struggling with alcohol use disorder or you want to modify your drinking habits, Ria Health is an excellent option. Ria Health earned 4.5 out of 5 stars from our independent review. To learn more about this program, check out our in-depth [review of Ria Health](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/ria-health-review/). Bicycle Health - Best for Opioid Use Disorder Bicycle Health provides medication-assisted treatment to those struggling with opioid use disorder (OUD). All services are offered virtually through their mobile app in select states, and in-person treatment is available in some cities. Bicycle Health offers a monthly plan for $199.00 and accepts many major health insurance plans, so actual costs may be less. Pros & Cons of Bicycle Health How Much Does Bicycle Health Cost? Bicycle Health costs $199.00 for those paying out-of-pocket. This plan does not include the cost of medication. Key Services of Bicycle Health Bicycle Health's key focus is to make medication-assisted treatment more accessible to those battling opioid addictions, which is why it's our top pick for online [OUD treatment](https://www.choosingtherapy.com/opioid-treatment/). Their streamlined onboarding process can help patients virtually connect with doctors and receive prescriptions on the same day. Bicycle Health also offers online group support meetings several times a week. Bicycle Health only prescribes suboxone. Suboxone is an FDA-approved drug that has proven to be effective in treating opioid addiction. Suboxone contains buprenorphine, antagonist. Buprenorphine binds to opioid receptors in the brain with minimal activation, while naltrexone blocks the activation of opioid receptors. Suboxone can help reduce cravings, ease withdrawal symptoms, and significantly reduce the risk of relapse4 Bicycle Health earned 4 out of 5 stars from our independent review. Medication-assisted treatment is a form of recovery care that provides both medication and counseling for those battling addiction. It's often referred to as a "whole-person" approach to treating substance use disorders. Research shows that medication-assisted treatment can increase patients' chances of remaining sober and reduce the risk of relapse and overdose.1 What Are the Benefits of Online Addiction Treatment Programs? The following are some benefits of online addiction treatment programs: - Access to medications to aid in managing cravings and reducing withdrawal symptoms - Therapy and counseling to address underlying mental health symptoms - Flexible appointment scheduling - Convenience of receiving treatment without leaving your home - More private than in-person treatment - Easier to communicate with doctors, therapists, and addiction specialists through chat, text messages, and video calls If you've tried in-person medication-assisted treatment or addiction therapy in the past and found it difficult to commit to a program due to busy schedules, lack of transportation, or because you live in a remote area without accessible care, an online medication-assisted treatment program could be a good fit for you
